## Description {#details}

The helper class to build type name based on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a> properties.

It builds synthetic name based on explicit attributes: DW&#95;AT&#95;name, DW&#95;AT&#95;linkage&#95;name or based on implicit attributes(DW&#95;AT&#95;decl&#42;). Names for specific DIEs(like subprograms, template classes...) include additional attributes: subprogram parameters, template parameters, array ranges. Examples of built name:

class A &#123; &#125; : &#123;8&#125;A

namspace llvm &#123; class A &#123; &#125; &#125; : &#123;1&#125;llvm&#123;8&#125;A

template &lt;int&gt; structure B &#123; &#125; : &#123;F&#125;B&lt;&#123;0&#125;int&gt;

void foo ( int p1, float p3 ) : &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int, &#123;0&#125;int)

int &#42;ptr; : &#123;c&#125;ptr &#123;0&#125;int

int var; : &#123;d&#125;var

These names is used to refer DIEs describing types.

Definition at line 46 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-h">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### assignName() {#ac007678ea81a8e5ab91596fb0825513c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error SyntheticTypeNameBuilder::assignName (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/unitentrypairty">UnitEntryPairTy</a> InputUnitEntryPair, std::optional&lt; std::pair&lt; size&#95;t, size&#95;t &gt; &gt; ChildIndex)</>}>
Create synthetic name for the specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a> <code>InputUnitEntryPair</code> and assign created name to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a> type info.

<code>ChildIndex</code> is used to create name for ordered DIEs(function arguments f.e.).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-h/#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-h">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-cpp/#l00019">19</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-cpp">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder.cpp</a>.

### addDIETypeName() {#ac0f5b717fb77c6c02c668e29b9764c9e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error SyntheticTypeNameBuilder::addDIETypeName (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/unitentrypairty">UnitEntryPairTy</a> InputUnitEntryPair, std::optional&lt; std::pair&lt; size&#95;t, size&#95;t &gt; &gt; ChildIndex, bool AssignNameToTypeDescriptor)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Analyze <code>InputUnitEntryPair</code> for the type name and possibly assign built type name to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a>&#39;s type info.

NOTE: while analyzing types we may create different kind of names for the same type depending on whether the type is part of another type. f.e. DW&#95;TAG&#95;formal&#95;parameter would receive &quot;&#123;02&#125;01&quot; name when examined alone. Or &quot;&#123;0&#125;int&quot; name when it is a part of a function name: &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int). The <code>AssignNameToTypeDescriptor</code> tells whether the type name is part of another type name and then should not be assigned to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a> type descriptor.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-h/#l00108">108</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-h">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-cpp/#l00393">393</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/dwarflinker/lib/dwarflinker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder-cpp">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
